item.title: Tracy add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tracy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Safeguarding the rights of others is the most noble and beautiful end of a human being." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Work is love made visible. And if you can't work with love, but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of the people who work with joy" -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "Books, Cats, Life is Good." -- Edward Gorey
